lessons.name: Deh Lêker
lessons.subtitle: Ten Verbs — Affirmative & Negative
lessons.learningObjective: Learn 10 verbs in both affirmative and negative forms with real sentence examples

activities.instruction: Learn this verb pair
activities.example: Em neynikê difroşin. Em neynikê nafroşin.
activities.exampleTranslation: We sell the mirror. We don't sell the mirror.

activities.instruction: Learn this verb pair
activities.example: Hêlîn helbestê dinivîse. Serhat helbestê nanivîse.
activities.exampleTranslation: Hêlîn writes the poem. Serhat does not write the poem.

activities.instruction: Learn this verb pair
activities.example: Jin pere dide. Mêr pere nade.
activities.exampleTranslation: The woman gives money. The man does not give money.

activities.instruction: Read the affirmative and negative pairs
activities.title: Erênî û Neyînî — Affirmative & Negative

lines.ku: Em neynikê difroşin. — Em neynikê nafroşin.
lines.en: We sell the mirror. — We don't sell the mirror.

lines.ku: Tu gulê digirî. — Tu gulê nagirî.
lines.en: You hold the rose. — You don't hold the rose.

lines.ku: Amed rojnameyê dikire. — Amed rojnameyê nakire.
lines.en: Amed buys the newspaper. — Amed doesn't buy the newspaper.

lines.ku: Hêlîn helbestê dinivîse. — Serhat helbestê nanivîse.
lines.en: Hêlîn writes the poem. — Serhat doesn't write the poem.

lines.ku: Jin pere dide. — Mêr pere nade.
lines.en: The woman gives money. — The man doesn't give money.

lines.ku: Ronî kartolê dixwe. — Hûn kartolê naxwin.
lines.en: Ronî eats potatoes. — You (pl.) don't eat potatoes.

activities.instruction: How do you negate "difroşin" (we sell)?
activities.explanation: For regular verbs, replace the di- prefix with na-: difroşin → nafroşin. This is the standard negation pattern for present tense.

activities.instruction: "Hêlîn helbestê dinivîse." What does Hêlîn do?
activities.explanation: dinivîse = writes (from nivîsîn = to write). helbest = poem. Hêlîn writes the poem.

activities.instruction: Make it negative: Jin pere dide. → Mêr pere ___.
activities.explanation: dide → nade. Replace di- with na-: dide → nade. The man does not give money.

activities.instruction: Make it negative: Ez xanî dibînim. → Hêlîn xanî ___.
activities.explanation: dibîne → nabîne. Replace di- with na- for he/she form. Hêlîn does not see the house.

activities.instruction: Match each affirmative with its negative
"Ronî kartolê dixwe." What is kartol?
activities.explanation: kartol = potato (from German Kartoffel). "Ronî kartolê dixwe" = Ronî eats potatoes.

lessons.name: Hevok Çêkirin
lessons.subtitle: Building Sentences
lessons.learningObjective: Build questions and answers using verbs: avêtin, çûn, dan, dîtin — with real Kurdish sentence patterns

activities.instruction: Learn this question pattern
activities.example: Tu çi davêjî? — Ez zebeşê davêjim.
activities.exampleTranslation: What do you throw? — I throw the watermelon.

activities.instruction: Learn this question pattern
activities.example: Tu diçî ku? — Ez diçim Berlinê.
activities.exampleTranslation: Where do you go? — I go to Berlin.

activities.instruction: Learn this question pattern
activities.example: Tu kê dibînî? — Ez te dibînim.
activities.exampleTranslation: Who do you see? — I see you.

activities.instruction: Read the Q&A pairs
activities.title: Hevok Çêkirin — Building Sentences

lines.ku: Tu çi davêjî? — Ez zebeşê davêjim.
lines.en: What do you throw? — I throw the watermelon.

lines.ku: Tu diçî ku? — Ez diçim Berlinê.
lines.en: Where do you go? — I go to Berlin.

lines.ku: Ez naçim Hamburgê.
lines.en: I don't go to Hamburg.

lines.ku: Tu çi didî? — Ez goşt didim.
lines.en: What do you give? — I give meat.

lines.ku: Ez xwêyê nadim.
lines.en: I don't give salt.

lines.ku: Kî kê dibîne? — Alan Delalê dibîne.
lines.en: Who sees whom? — Alan sees Delal.

lines.ku: Meryem çiya dibîne. Hêvî gur dibîne.
lines.en: Meryem sees the mountain. Hêvî sees the wolf.

activities.instruction: "Tu diçî ku?" — What does this question ask?
activities.explanation: "Tu diçî ku?" = Where do you go? diçî = you go (from çûn), ku = where (destination).

activities.instruction: "Kî kê dibîne?" — Alan Delalê dibîne. Who sees whom?
activities.explanation: Kî = who (subject), kê = whom (object). Alan (subject) Delalê (object, fem. +ê) dibîne (sees). Alan sees Delal.

activities.instruction: Complete: Tu çi ___? — Ez zebeşê davêjim.
activities.explanation: For "tu" (you), the ending is -î: davêjî. The verb avêtin (to throw) → davêjî in present tense for tu.

activities.instruction: Complete: Ez diçim ___.
activities.explanation: City names take -ê when used as a destination: Berlin → Berlinê. "Ez diçim Berlinê" = I go to Berlin.

activities.instruction: Match the question to the correct answer
Make it negative: Ez diçim Kölnê. → Ez ___ Kölnê.
activities.explanation: diçim → naçim. Replace di- with na-: I don't go to Cologne.

lessons.name: Erênî û Neyînî
lessons.subtitle: Affirmative & Negative — Four Rules
lessons.learningObjective: Master the four negation patterns in Kurdish: bûn→ne, verbs→na-, zanîn/karîn→ni-, hebûn→tune

activities.instruction: Learn negation rule 1
activities.translation: For bûn (to be): add 'ne' before the adjective
activities.example: Ez baş im → Ez ne baş im.
activities.exampleTranslation: I am good → I am not good.

activities.instruction: Learn negation rule 2
activities.translation: Replace di- with na- for all regular verbs
activities.exampleTranslation: Agît sees → Agît does not see.

activities.instruction: Learn negation rule 3
activities.translation: zanîn (know) and karîn (can) use ni- instead of na-
activities.example: Ez kurdî dizanim → Ez tirkî nizanim.
activities.exampleTranslation: I know Kurdish → I don't know Turkish.

activities.instruction: Learn negation rule 4
activities.translation: For hebûn (to have/exist): use 'tune' for negation
activities.exampleTranslation: There is water → There is no water.

activities.instruction: Read the Q&A with yes/no answers
activities.title: Erê / Na — Yes / No

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Hûn pirtûkê dikirin?
lines.en: Do you (pl.) buy the book?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Erê, em pirtûkê dikirin.
lines.en: Yes, we buy the book.

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Na, em pirtûkê nakirin.
lines.en: No, we don't buy the book.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Tu deng dibihîzî?
lines.en: Do you hear the sound?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Erê, ez deng dibihîzim.
lines.en: Yes, I hear the sound.

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Na, ez deng nabihîzim.
lines.en: No, I don't hear the sound.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ew goşt û birinc dixwe?
lines.en: Does he/she eat meat and rice?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Na, ew goşt û birinc naxwe.
lines.en: No, he/she doesn't eat meat and rice.

activities.instruction: How do you negate "Ez kurdî dizanim"?
activities.explanation: zanîn (to know) uses the special ni- prefix for negation: dizanim → nizanim. This also applies to karîn (to be able).

activities.instruction: Which negation pattern is used with bûn (to be)?
activities.explanation: With bûn, the word "ne" is placed before the adjective/noun: Ez baş im → Ez ne baş im. Ew tî ye → Ew ne tî ye.

activities.instruction: Negate: Ew diçin → Ew ___.
activities.explanation: çûn is a regular verb, so replace di- with na-: diçin → naçin.

activities.instruction: Negate: Ez tirkî dizanim → Ez tirkî ___.
activities.explanation: zanîn uses ni- for negation: dizanim → nizanim. NOT nazanim!

activities.instruction: Match each verb type to its negation pattern
